roleset.name: (cause to) go fast
roleset.note: SPEED-V NOTES: Based on annotation-on-the-fly on the financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls run-51.3.2. (from speed.01-v)
SPEEDING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, speed-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls run-51.3.2. (from speeding.01-n)

example.name: lawbreaker
example.text: John always speeds in his Chevette.

example.name: with agent
example.text: The Los Alamos laboratory is one of three U.S. Department of Energy national laboratories designed as pilot centers to foster joint industry-government programs [0]-1 [*T*-1]to speed the transfer of new superconductors to the marketplace.
example.arg: the transfer of new superconductors to the marketplace

example.name: with redundant directional
example.text: The market's wild week may speed along the market-reform legislation that has been pending for months in the aftermath of the 1987 crash.
example.arg: the market-reform legislation that has been pending for months in the aftermath of the 1987 crash

example.name: arg1
example.text: According to Kyle Evans, he says he stopped a man and inquired about the reason for his speeding.

example.name: both args
example.text: The doctor had a thrilling experience on his homeward trip, which necessitated his speeding his car,

roleset.name: speed up: accelerate, cause to move fast

example.name: faster, pussycat! kill, kill!
example.text: The withdrawal of New England Electric might speed up the reorganization process.
example.arg: The withdrawal of New England Electric

roleset.name: going fast
roleset.note: SPEEDY-J NOTES: Based on speed.01 (from speedy.01-j)

example.name: lawbreaker
example.text: John is always speedys in his Chevette.

example.name: with agent
example.text: The transfer of new superconductors to the marketplace is speedy.
example.arg: The transfer of new superconductors to the marketplace
